activities.message: @yarbabin Can you still reproduce this? Doesn't seem to be working correctly.

activities.message:
Its still working. URL decode SAMLResponse parameter, then decode base64. Change evilhost to your host. After this i have request on my host:

`connect to [95.213.191.87] from ec2-54-149-98-204.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com [54.149.98.204] 53883`
`GET /xxe HTTP/1.1`
`Cache-Control: no-cache`
`Pragma: no-cache`
`User-Agent: Java/1.8.0_66`
`Host: 95.213.191.87`
`Accept: text/html, image/gif, image/jpeg, *; q=.2, */*; q=.2`
`Connection: keep-alive`

activities.message:
Hello @yarbabin,

Our team has remediated this vulnerability. Please check your original Proof of Concept, and let us know if you think the bug is still exploitable. If you find a way to bypass our fix, please open a new and give us further details. Thanks for your efforts in keeping Informatica safe, and well done!

Regards,
The Informatica Team

activities.message:
Congratulations! Your bug is eligible for swag. Please make sure your address and shirt size are correct in Hacker One.

Thank you!
